items.title: Normal heart sounds
items.teach: Anchor S1 at the apex (mitral closure) and S2 at the base (A2 then P2). Start every exam by finding S1/S2 first.

items.title: Innocent/functional murmur
items.teach: Benign in young/healthy; early systolic, short, non-radiating. Normal S2 splitting and pulses.

items.title: Mitral stenosis
items.teach: Left lateral decubitus with bell at apex. Rheumatic disease classic. The shorter the A2→OS interval, the more severe.

items.title: Bicuspid aortic valve (AS ± AR)
items.teach: AS: RUSB with carotid radiation; parvus et tardus possible. If AR present: blowing early diastolic at LSB, bounding pulses/wide PP.

items.title: Ventricular septal defect
items.teach: Pan-systolic at LLSB. Handgrip increases systemic resistance → louder L→R shunt murmur.

items.title: Mitral regurgitation with MVP
items.teach: MVP click earlier/louder with Valsalva/standing (↓ preload); later/softer with squatting. MR classically radiates to axilla.

items.title: Patent ductus arteriosus
items.teach: Continuous through systole and diastole. Associations: prematurity, congenital rubella. Indomethacin closes (unless kept open intentionally).
